page.title: 11EDUCATION, LIVINGSTON SOUTH
page.content: Eight pupils of{Bankton Primary {School}went to{Bellsquarry Primary {School}to find out what an old school was like. Bankton, our school, was completed in 1979, Bellsquarry in 1909. We noticed how small the school was and they had only 18 pupils and two teachers. We have about 525 pupils and 23 teachers. There are only 4 rooms in Bellsquarry. A gym hall where Mrs Tait, the head teacher, takes music and P.E., a dining hall where children eat their dinner and watch T.V. and two classrooms which were different from ours. In the corner of each room is a boarded up fireplace which once was used to heat the rooms. They now have central heating like us. We have 16 open teaching areas and 8 portable units making a total of 24 class rooms.
